original_title: CT Holdings and Cargills come to the fore of CSE trading in the wake of profit-takings
original_body_lines: CSE trading as a whole showed profit- takings yesterday but the market was mainly driven by two companies; Cargills and CT Holdings.Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. The All Share Price Index went up by 96.5 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 0.76 points.

Turnover stood at Rs 3.1 billion with three crossings. Those crossings were reported in HNB (Non- Voting) where 200,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 59.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 299, Melstacorp 150,000 shares crossed for Rs 23.78 million; its shares traded at Rs 158.50 and Lanka Tiles 380,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.4 million; its shares traded at Rs 53.

In the retail market top companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Prime Lands Rs 158 million (8.2 million shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 114 million (651,000 shares traded), HNB Rs 113 million (299,000 shares traded), JKH Rs 96.1 million (4.1 million shares traded), Seylan Bank (Non- Voting) Rs 83.8 million (1.2 million shares traded), Pan Asia Bank Rs 82.8 million (1.4 million shares traded). During the day 105 million shares volumes changed hands in 26000 transactions.

It is said that the banking and financial sector was most active at the floor, especially HNB and Commercial Bank, while the manufacturing sector, especially JKH, was the second highest contributor to the turnover.
Further, Almas Equities said it increased its shares in listed investment trust, Galle Face Capital Partners, to over 10 percent of the company’s issued share capital.
Yesterday the rupee was quoted at Rs 300.60/65 to the US dollar, slightly stronger from last Thursday’s close of Rs 300.70/78 in the spot market, while bonds were steady, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 8.05/15 percent Monday from Thursday’s 8.05/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 8.45/55 slightly higher from 8.40/50 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2028 was quoted at 9.85/95 from 8.85/9.92 percent
A bond maturing on 15.10.2029 quoted at 9.35/40 from 9.35/38 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.38/42 from 9.38/40 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.25/35 down from 10.27/33 percent
A bond maturing on 01.06.2033 quoted at 10.65/70 up from 10.63/70 percent.
